Wish you could apply your Machine Learning and Software Engineering experience to help dogs everywhere? Now you can. If you have a passion for working quickly to design, develop, train and deploy machine learning models to help pets lead longer, healthier and happier lives, we want to hear from you. Check out your dream job below.

A BIT ABOUT OUR PET INSIGHT TEAM

Pet Insight is a team of data scientists, technologists, and vets that have partnered with Whistle Labs - the premier pet care IoT technology, Banfield Pet Hospital - the largest general veterinary practice in the United States, and pet owners - citizen scientists, to conduct the largest population health study in pet care.

The Pet Insight Project has been built fresh, from the ground up, with modern best-in-class technologies. In a short time, our small team (with the support of the larger Kinship and Whistle teams) has created a brand-new system, built around our unique machine learning algorithms that have been trained and validated on an unmatched volume of real-world data. While there's plenty of work left to be done, we are building out and scaling up, and our system is already helping us to understand the life of a pet on a second-by-second basis, in a level of detail never explored before. We're looking for an expert in creating and training data-driven models to lead the extension of our current technologies and develop new and innovative ways that ML can help improve the lives of pets. As part of our small team of like-minded data scientists, you'll also help deploy these models to production to help process time-series sensor data, classify images, label sounds, or even help understand videos depending on the specific use case.

HOW YOU'LL CREATE A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS

The work you'll do here is critically important because "pets can't talk." In turn, Pet Insight is using artificial intelligence to develop advanced deep learning models ( see FilterNet https://www.mdpi.com/1424-8220/20/9/2498 ) to uncover important links between pet behaviors, activity, and health. This understanding is critical to telling a more complete "health story" and empowering pet owners to better care for the animals they love. It also has the power to transform conventional veterinary medicine, by moving the profession beyond generally accepted practice to a whole new level of personalized care driven by objective, evidence-based, precision-medicine.

Your job will be to leverage our one of a kind dataset to help shape and build applications that use machine learning models to help improve the lives of pets by:

Extending and improving Pet Insight's state-of-the-art deep learning architecture for activity recognition to provide owners with even more valuable information about their pets' behaviors.

Developing, implementing, and deploying machine learning models that leverage our unique combination of behavior data and medical record data to detect and alert owners to potential health problems using changes in the pets' behaviors.

Performing statistical analysis on the outputs of these machine learning models to help update, re-train, and then deploy new ML models to help improve the overall data processing pipeline.

Leading development, design, and experimentation to quickly prototype and test new and innovative ways that machine learning can help improve the lives of pets.

Improve and extend machine learning models used to predict a dog's behavior from sensor-based time-series data.

Developing methodologies for inferring a pet's health from its behaviors using retrospective analyses with medical records.

Quickly creating prototypes and conduct experiments to investigate the feasibility of new and innovative ways to keep pets healthier and happier using machine learning.

Contributing to the creation, deployment, and scaling of machine learning and predictive algorithms in a production environment.

Using Python and many of the common scientific packages extensively, including PyTorch, Pandas, and scikit-learn to output the data we calculate for each dog to a distributed file system so that we can use big-data tools like Spark to help us understand it.

Where appropriate, you will use other AWS services, and we are open to maturing and improving our systems via other technologies.

WHO WE NEED TO CHART THE FUTURE OF PET CARE

We strive to hire people who are passionate about our mission: Creating A Better World for Pets. We believe what we do is just as important as how we do it, and we aim to hire people who value our cultural pillars:

Optimistic . Those who's boundlessly energy and enthusiasm for what's next shines through in everything they do. We seek to work with people who are intrinsically happy, and who will drive our vision and purpose while managing the complexities of our businesses.

Purposefully Inquisitive . Those who are courageous and use their deep business insights to cultivate innovation . We want the trailblazers in tech. Those who are entrepreneurs at heart, ask the tough questions , adapt quickly to new situations , and analyze data in new ways to push our big ideas forward.

Open to All . Those who are inclusive leaders , committed to learning, and leveraging our differences as strengths. We hire people who are naturally collaborative and thrive in a flat and flexible organization . Those who are thoughtful communicators, and seek to foster meaningful relationships across our community of diverse partners.

And for this role, we hope you have the following skills we require to round out our team:

Here's what we're looking for in a strong candidate:
Technical degree (BS/MS/PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics).

5+ years experience in machine learning and software development.

Experience with developing new machine learning models and deploying them to production.

Experience with the Python analytics tools suites (Pandas, numpy, Jupyter notebooks, etc.).

Experience with machine learning (like scikit-learn) and deep learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch).

Strong experience in writing and maintaining production level code.

Experience with machine learning on time-series data.

If you also had these experiences, you'd knock it out of the dog park:

Experience working with electronic medical records (EMRs).

Experience with natural language processing (NLP) and text mining.

Experience with statistical modeling, and hypothesis testing.

WHY JOIN US?

We offer our associates a unique opportunity to have a completely customizable career within pet care. Through Kinship you will work with and learn from a community of industry executives, pet partners, entrepreneurs, and fellow associates across our startup investment companies, outside partners, and in Mars Petcare. Our nimble and flexible approach to work allows you to make an immediate impact across businesses, while learning new skills at every stage. The diversity of our work opens doors to big opportunities and unlocks enormous potential for countless career experiences in pet care. Join us in our mission to chart the future of pet care, alongside the industry's brightest minds.

Kinship's offices are global, and so are our associates. We are located in NYC, San Francisco, Portland, London, Helsinki, Shanghai, and in Moscow. Many of us flex between our dog-friendly hubs and our home offices. Today, Kinship offers exceptional benefits for you, your family, and your pets, generous paid time off, exponential opportunities to build a career within pet care, and progressive reward packages. Interested? Let's take big strides, together.

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

job_description:

The Roku Voice team is looking for an ambitious senior engineer with a background in one or more of the following areas: natural language understanding, machine learning, natural language question answering, content personalization, knowledge graphs, semantic web technologies, multi-modal dialog, and conversational systems.

Propose innovative ideas to improve the accuracy and artificial intelligence capabilities of the Roku spoken language system

Document your work via internal wikis, design documents, and slide presentations

Stay current on published state-of-the-art techniques for NLU and conversational systems

What we need from you for this role:
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Linguistics or related field
Strong track record of developing novel and scientifically sound solutions to solve real world problems
Practical experience in one or more of the following areas: natural language understanding, machine learning, natural language question answering, content personalization, knowledge graphs, semantic web technologies, multi-modal dialog, and conversational systems
Solid programming skills in C++ or Java, and/or scripting languages in a Unix environment
Practical experience with cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets
Strong oral and written skills
Ability to thrive as a self-driven employee who can follow tasks from conception to production

Position: Senior Engineering Unicorn
Location: San Diego, CA
Classification Exempt
Reports to: Director of Engineering
Date 5/14/2020

Who we are:
Kazuhm a cutting-edge startup based in San Diego is building a brand new way to process digital workloads, reducing dependency on the cloud, and allowing organizations to tap into their unused compute resources from server to desktop, and all the way to the Edge. Kazuhm unifies these resources into a heterogeneous distributed computing system such that an organization's unused compute power can be effectively used to securely process even the largest, most complex workloads. Kazuhm is venture-backed by Analytics Ventures (www.analyticsventures.com), which specializes in venture formation of Artificial Intelligence and Internet-of-Things (IoT) based companies.

Job Description
Do you like wearing a bunch of different hats? Are you maybe a seasoned software developer whose interests run towards operations? Or maybe you are a seasoned system engineer with a little more formal development experience? Do you actually have a rainbow-colored horn growing out of your forehead?! Kazuhm is looking for a talented individual to become part of its core team of innovators and visionaries. To have success on this team you must be flexible, self-directed, inventive, and thrive in a fast-paced environment while delivering amazing results. The ideal candidate will have a passion for and experience in creating next-generation distributed computing systems, containerized microservices, and scalable applications using bleeding-edge technologies.
Ideal Qualifications/Experience
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
10+ years of experience in multidisciplinary I.T. roles
Language preference: Javascript, Golang, Python (Don't forget Bash!)
Standard development tools and utilities: MS Code, Git, etc
Standard system engineering tools and utilities (config management, scripting/automation, monitoring/alerting, etc)
You are a vi enthusiast
Developing, deploying, and operating containerized software (Docker, Kubernetes, etc)
Distributed computing, High Performance/Throughput Computing
Infrastructure & Operations: Compute, Storage, Networking, Virtualization, Datacenter
Devops/SCM: Jenkins, Bitbucket Pipelines, CI/CD, automation, etc
Security best practices (development and production)
Production environment best practices
Solution architecture, through implementation and operationalization

How would you like to impact the experience of 800 million users per month? Be on the forefront of digital transformation? Do you enjoy work in a start-up like environment? Innovate using Bots, AI and Voice? The Digital & Data Support Business Unit (D2SBU) was recently created to accelerate the Customer Service and Support digital transformation: we are creating a world class support experience for our customers, empower customers to self-solve more of their issues and be more satisfied with their self-help experience. In addition we are developing rich and advanced experience for our engineers and advocate to be able to support our customers and creating friction free advanced support. The D2SBU Engineering team design and build software features, services, diagnostics and products to provide digital support experiences to customers and support engineers.

We are actively hiring for Software Engineers to join the D2SBU Engineering team that is responsible for the design and development of software features, services, diagnostics and products to provide digital support experiences to customers and support engineers. This position reports to a Digital Customer Support Software Engineering Lead for either Experiences + Devices (E+D), Cloud + Artificial intelligence (C+AI), and Modern Life + Gaming workstreams and offers the ability to focus on customer scenarios spanning multiple backend platforms that are the basis of Microsoft’s Azure, Office 365, and Gaming experiences.
Responsibilities
We are looking for Senior Software Engineers that are naturally curious and has experience building features and capabilities on large-scale services. You will redefine customer's online support experience built upon machine learning and artificial intelligence. A successful candidate should have experience in all phases of the development cycle and will leverage this experience to design, build, deploy, and maintain online support features for customers. You will have the opportunity to apply your deep technical expertise to enable a great customer experience and to mentor members of the team.

Successful candidates will exhibit various attributes which will enhance their ability to succeed in these various positions:


Collaboration - As most development is about working with others, both within an immediate team, as well as across business units and portions of the company, an ability to collaborate effectively is a core competency.


Customer Focus - Understands how engineering decisions result in added customer value.
Drive For Results - Being able to drive for results, not merely finding the boundary of your responsibility, but following a problem through to its conclusion, to solve it once and for all, is a skill and ability which a successful engineer should exhibit.


Technical Excellence - Core to being a software engineer is of course technical excellence. This is not merely knowing the latest and greatest language developments, but demonstrating a passion for technology, a curiosity to ‘go deep’, and an ability to quickly learn and build upon past experiences, to be able to extrapolate from those experiences, and deliver innovations. Technical excellence is rooted in having a strong demonstrable aptitude for problem solving.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering IT technical discipline or equivalent engineering/software/services experience
6+ years of experience as a software engineer or software developer.

Preferred Qualifications:Experience coding and debugging in languages such as C#, C++, Java, or similar modern development languages
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, programming patterns, and solving complex problems
Demonstrated history of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated history of good decision-making, conflict resolution, and follow through
Strong written & oral communication skills
Highly Desirable: Knowledge of frameworks such as Angular.js, React, Ruby on Rails
Highly Desirable: Experience with big data solutions, technologies, and analysis tools such as Azure Data lake, Azure Data factory, Hadoop, R-server, Python, etc.

job_title: Senior Front End Engineer - Agent Search
정리된 job_title: Senior Front End Engineer - Agent Search
job_description:
Compass is building the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers and sellers through technology. Until Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the "Artificial Intelligence" that cloud, mobile and AI technologies enable. We are building AI to empower AI - Artificial Intelligence to empower Agent Intelligence.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry larger than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform the real estate industry. In 2019 we tripled the size of our engineering team, and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the engineering organization.

You are a senior developer who is passionate about creating a fantastic home-search experience and you feel it is critical that your voice is heard in product and business decisions.

You love to learn, and equally love to share your knowledge with others. You're both a listener and contributor. You are a great communicator and you take care to understand before making yourself understood.You love trying out new frameworks and libraries.

At Compass You Will:
Build, develop and scale our platform that powers real estate agents, buyers and sellers
Write JavaScript code that is architected for scalability and re-use. Have strong opinions on code structure and modularization. Write semantic HTML and be a master of your CSS pre-processor.
Collaborate with product and design to move fast on creating solutions to business problems.
Inspire, recruit and mentor your engineering colleagues
Operate in a scalable engineering culture that leverages modern principles of decoupled systems and automated CI/CD/testing/monitoring to drive efficiencies

What We Look For:
BS in CS or EE or equivalent
Proven track record working in top talent and high performance environments
5+ years experience with NPM & JavaScript including modern frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.
Experience with Redux, ES6, Webpack is a plus
Can contribute best-practices and architectural leadership to our front end applications
In-depth experiencing leading and owning projects from beginning to end
In-depth experience with agile methodologies and automated testing with some exposure to TDD & pair programming
Familiarity with containerization, microservices architecture, continuous integration and delivery is a plus

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Check out our Engineering blog !

Join a diverse development team in developing and supporting a cutting-edge, enterprise tool that increases collaboration amongst defense agencies, allows data analysts to leverage the power of sophisticated data mining techniques and ultimately enables decisions makers to make national security decisions using the most accurate and up-to-date data analytic capabilities.
You will work with big-data and real-time analytics and cutting-edge technologies in an Amazon Web Service (AWS) microservices framework.

Ensure software process and configuration management
Manage and ensure quality control

Java and C/C++ programming experience

Exceptional trouble shooting and resolution skills.

Position Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran
Qualifications:
Imagine a world-class engineering environment. Now add a team of exceptional talent along with technologies that are so advanced they’re often classified. That’s what you’ll find at General Dynamics Mission Systems. Here you’ll lead amazing engineers as they invent the technologies, products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. If you want the chance to lead, it’s time to bring your talent to General Dynamics Mission Systems.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.

General Dynamics Mission Systems has an immediate opening for an Electrical Design Engineer (RF). This position provides an opportunity to further advance the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nation’s core defense/intelligence services and systems. General Dynamics Mission Systems employees work closely with esteemed customers to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions.

REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES AND TASKS:
Performs design and development in such areas as electrical, electromagnetic, electromechanical and software for production, transmission, measurement, and use of systems, instruments and controls
Leads the development of strategic tasks or small projects by applying engineering and organizational knowledge and expertise to achieve technical goals
Understands and interprets the technical, organizational and process aspects of the tasks assigned and can relate them to the technical needs of the overall project or organization
Plans and executes small projects or task elements within larger projects, organizations, or for groups of projects
Responsible for the completion of assigned engineering tasks or small projects within budgetary and scheduling guidelines
Actively uncovers technical and organizational risks and ensures they are included in risk mitigation plans
Participates in development of program strategies and teaming strategies as they relate to the assigned task
Participates in the proposal process
Participates in feasibility studies and testing on new and modified designs
Carries out other tasks, not listed, assigned by supervisor
Travel will be required
SPECIFIC DUTIES AND TASKS:
Assist with legacy radome system production and testing
Assist with proposal development, specification negotiation, radome design and radome performance analysis for new projects in areas of RF performance, lightning protection and low observables
Provide expertise in addressing production problems and repairs
Develop test plans, procedures and data processing tools for radome testing
Technical writing for formal engineering reports including qualification and acceptance reports
Develop and present radome design, performance and test data for customer reviews
Participate in radome qualification testing
KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
A strong background in mathematics and statistics
Experience and coursework that support a fundamental understanding of electromagnetics
Strong foundation and experience in programming using one or more of the following: FORTRAN, LabView, C++ or Python
The ability to carry out analysis of systems, particularly radar and communication systems
PREFERRED SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Experience with modeling and predicting performance of RF windows
Experience with programming of motion control systems and / or microwave test equipment
Experience with development and executing electromagnetic solvers
An understanding of statistical methods in process control
Experience acting as Principal Investigator for Independent Research and Development (IRAD) projects
Ability to fulfill the technical lead position of customer-funded radome programs

PREFERRED DEGREE TYPES AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited program with emphasis on electromagnetics. Master's Degree is preferred.
Design or test experience with antennas and/or radomes

Location:

The successful candidate will join the team of engineering professionals in our Composite Solutions facility in Marion, Virginia. This position offers the flexibility to work out of the General Dynamics Mission Systems offices located in the Virginia Tech Corporate Research Center COgro facility in Blacksburg, Virginia.

Attractions in Southwest Virginia
Southwest Virginia offers scenic parks, recreation trails, historic towns, rich arts and culture, and numerous opportunities for outdoor activities and adventures.
Parks including Grayson Highlands State Park which provides access to the Appalachian Trail and the Virginia Highlands Horse Trail. The Hungry Mother State Park just outside the town of Marion offers a 108-acre lake, fishing, beach, campgrounds, and hiking trails.
The Virginia Creeper Trail which runs 34.3 miles from historic Abingdon to Whitetop Station, near the North Carolina border.
Numerous horseback trails that provide access to some of Southwest Virginia’s most stunning high country, including 200 miles of equestrian trails in the Mount Rogers National Recreation Area, the 68-mile Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, and nearly 10 miles of riding trails in Grayson Highlands State Park (with overnight facilities for campers with horses).
The Barter Theatre in Abingdon, VA and the Lincoln Theatre in Marion, VA.
Birthplace of Country Music Museum in Bristol, VA.

We are now looking for a Senior Software Engineer for our Robotics Team! For two decades, we have pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU - the engine of modern visual computing - the field has expanded to encompass video games, movie production, research, and autonomous machines.
The team is building a robotics platform for developing the next generation of intelligent robots. NVIDIA’s ISAAC Robotics Platform is binding together high-fidelity visual and physical simulation, a high-quality developing platform, hundreds of optimized algorithms to tackle hard problems in computer vision and artificial intelligence, and a small and powerful computational platform to form the brain of intelligent machines. Our team consists of experts from all over the world and dozens of different fields, and together we want to change the way how robots are programmed.
What you’ll be doing:
Lead the design, development & productize robotics fleet management software
The fleet services include SW deployment, robot health monitors, secure logging, mapping, assisted control & fleet planning with the knowledge of analytics
Utilize the power of NVIDIA EGX & Kubernetes to craft & develop the scalable framework
Work closely with dependent teams for their deliverables
Validate the framework with test nodes at first before wide scale deployment
Responsible for issue management during integration, testing, deployment & quality assurance
What we need to see from you:
BS or MS degree in electrical engineering / computer science related discipline or equivalent work experience
7+ years industry experience
Knowledge of docker containers & Kubernetes
Strong programming skills in C++ & Python
Ability to learn fast & debug complex system issues
Ability to adapt quickly to varying roles & responsibilities
Strong communication skills & a great teammate
Ways to stand out:
Previously created & worked with Docker containers
Familiar with container orchestration system such as Kubernetes
Experience building technical ownership in a cross organizational, multi-disciplinary team
You are or were leading a software project involving 5 or more engineers

job_title: Senior Full Stack Engineer- Identity Team
job_description:
Compass is building the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers, and sellers through technology. Before Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the Artificial Intelligence that cloud, mobile, and AI technologies enable.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry larger than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform the real estate industry. In 2019 we tripled the size of our Product & Engineering team, and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the engineering organization to join us as we continue to expand in 2020.

Compass' Identity Team is building Compass' Identity Service as a core, tier-1 system at the center of this platform. Our mission is to provide a seamless sign-up, login, and authentication experience for every user of our growing number of products and web services, including agents, consumers, staff and, eventually, 3rd party developers. As the source of truth for all users on the Compass platform, every one of our applications will depend on the Identity service for authentication and access. Operational excellence is required - security, performance, and availability at scale can't be compromised.

You are a senior full stack engineer who is passionate about creating a fantastic user experience and you feel it is critical that your voice is heard in product and business decisions. You love to learn, and equally love to share your knowledge with others. You are a great communicator and you take care to understand before making yourself understood. You will participate in all aspects of our development and provide expertise on both front and back end.

You are comfortable working on any part of the stack, from making a great interface to debugging our distributed infrastructure. Your code is architected for modularity and re-use. You have strong opinions on code structure and style.

What We're Looking For:
BS in CS or EE or equivalent
Track record as a technical leader with cross-team impact
6+ years of experience writing complete, well-tested, database-driven web applications
6+ years of experience programming in languages like Java, Python, and Go (we use all three here at Compass)
Experience designing larger systems: particularly web services and RESTful APIs, microservice architectures, and data ingestion with a particular emphasis of industry-standard best practices
An understanding of the Identity and Access Management space
In-depth understanding and hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Memcached
Experienced with AWS services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, and Kinesis
A security-minded engineer. You are familiar with application security vulnerabilities and remediation techniques.
Familiarity and hands-on experience with Javascript and frontend frameworks

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Check out our Engineering blog

Purpose: To Unite the world through health and happiness.


Organifi is a fun, fast paced environment of like minded professionals looking to make a difference in the world. We collaborate. We laugh. We’re obsessed with superfoods and we aligned to make BIG positive impact in the world.


Organifi, an industry leader in high quality nutrition products and superfoods is looking for an immediate hire to join our powerhouse team.


Are YOU The Right Fit?


You need to be a top performer. Is that you? If you think so, then you’re probably not. Now if you KNOW so, then ask yourself if this sounds familiar: Are you tired of glass ceilings in your current job? Do you feel held back? Are you curious about what you're REALLY capable of?


Think deep. Have you ever wanted to be a part of the thrill? Are you inspired by the story of the Silicon Valley startups? Do you envy the excitement of the 'accidental billionaires' who will be remembered for centuries? Scalable businesses change the world more than political movements, more than nations, even more than religions.


Do you crave culture? Great, join us in San Diego. We have a 14,000 square foot complex with a gym, sauna, shower, free snacks, coffee, arcade games, ping-pong, and even mid-day yoga classes. Special guests come in once a month to educate on a range of unique topics too, like meditation, mindfulness, fitness, spirituality, personal development and much more.


Want more freedom? Take unlimited vacations, paid. That's right. Prove yourself here, and you're treated like a king, queen, emperor, or whatever you like. Several of our top performing team members have taken year-long, multi-continental trips, while making their own hours.


Check us out here:

www.organifi.com

Job Summary:

We currently have part of our site on Shopify and part on Unbounce/Clickbank. We are looking for someone to be a leader in our front end development efforts who can not only maintain and add to those pages but also build out a completely new custom site of landing pages complete with checkout (via Stripe, Braintree or the like), upsell flows, (custom and tool based A/B testing), abandon cart features and more. We are looking to take our company to the next level of scale which means clean code, fast webpages, and fast results. We want webpages that load in 400ms to 1,000ms. If you are a high performing developer who loves writing clean code, fast webpages, bringing fast results, working with a collaborative team, being an autonomous player, establishing best practices and wants to have fun at the same time then we want to talk to you ASAP!
Our Director of Technology has done work for the Super Bowl, State Farm, Arizona Lottery, Tilted Kilt, Financial Executives International, hospitals and colleges across the United States and much more. He has also coded Artificial Intelligence and built multiple award winning websites. He loves to share his experience where it can be helpful but also wants to learn from everyone on the team including you. We are a team of learning, leading and striving to be the best at what we do. We all learn from each other and we all have a lot of fun. If you want to grow your career, make an impact on the world and have fun...join us!
Roles and Responsibilities


Build new full new custom website from the ground up with new payment processor like Stripe, Braintree, etc (payment processor TBD)

Maintain Shopify webpages

Maintain Unbounce/Clickbank webages

Love architecting big projects and also love building lots of landing pages for products with multiple upsell flows

Maintain and troubleshoot pixels

Work with backend developers

Work in GA/GTM

Manage HTML/CSS/Javascript cleanliness

Add new pages every time we add new products

Run/maintain A/B tests using tools and ultimately custom

Always think with scalability in mind

Be comfortable building an entire site top to bottom by yourself (even though you will have others to work with you)

Train others, learn from others, set and maintain best practices

Focus on teamwork

Work with various API’s from Google, Organifi, Facebook, Promotor io, Kount, Stripe, etc

Build cross-browser compatible webpages for desktop and mobile with a mobile first mindset

Be able to drive business results fast and not spend forever on code...there is a balance to the art of coding and driving results...we value clean code and we value fast business results

Communicate with project managers and other team members across the company

Write unit/integration/E2E tests

Domain management

Perks:


Unlimited PTO

Ability to work from home

You determine your own work schedule hours

No micro-management...full trust

On-site gym

DDR and ping pong tables

Free products monthly of your choice

Great salary, Bonus and Stock

A company not dependant on funding rounds...fully self sufficient with revenue
A company past all the early experiment phases and now in the fun growth/scale phase

Position Requirements


Shopify and Shopify Plus Experience

4-10 years in Javascript

4-8 years in HTML

4-8 years in CSS

2-4 years working with RESTful APIs

Experience with a payment processor like Stripe, Braintree or other

Ecommerce experience

Strongly Preferred

Knowledge of SRP, AOP and SOLID

Shopify experience

GA/GTM experience

AppZen delivers the world’s leading AI platform for modern finance teams. Starting with business spend, we automate manual process, uncover problems, and optimize decision making for enterprises around the globe, including one-fourth of the Fortune 500. Our platform combines patented deep learning, computer vision, and semantic analysis with intelligence from thousands of online data sources to understand financial transactions in business context and make decisions before those transactions happen. AppZen is a must have for CFOs and their teams to reduce spend, achieve compliance, and streamline process.

We’ve taken off this year! Since we released our platform in 2016, over 1,500 enterprises have standardized on AppZen, including three of the top ten banks, four of the top ten media companies, three of the top ten pharmaceutical manufacturers, two of the top five aerospace companies, and five of the top ten software providers. We were a Gartner Cool Vendor last year, have been recognized as one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the market, and we just announced $50 million in Series C funding.

We are looking for Senior Backend Software Engineers to extend our existing applications and to create new applications. In this role, you will help design and develop technology solutions that are scalable, relevant, and critical to our company's success. We believe in building the right product, we believe in using best practices, we believe in everybody's input. You will help drive us to a continuously delivered micro service environment. The ideal candidate will have at least 5+ years of experience working at a Cloud/SaaS company.
You Will:
Write well designed, clean, efficient code backed by unit tests
Develop scalable, lasting technology solutions
Contribute to and follow best practice coding standards
Build for security and performance
Work well in an Agile/Scrum environment (done the right way)
Maintain a high standard of work quality and encourage others to do the same
Energetic individual with enthusiasm to learn new tools, technologies & processes
Must Have:
Ability to write clean Java or Go code
5+ years of experience leading Java/Go based development projects
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field required; master's degree is a plus
Knowledge of micro services
Nice to Have:
Experience with workflow/orchestration engine
Experience with distribution system
Experience with K8S
AWS experience
Startup experience
Fun Facts about AppZen:
We have grown from 30 clients in 2017, to over 1,500 now
Grown 8x this year
Secured series C funding ($50 Million)
We have 1/3 of the Fortune 500 as clients
We have new products in the pipeline that will continue to grow
Join us in building the best back office artificial intelligence available to businesses.

Come as you are, we do not discriminate! We celebrate, support, and thrive upon our diverse customer and employee base.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Validation Framework - Robotics
job_description:
We are looking for a senior software engineer to build a Robust Validation Framework for our Robotics stack! For two decades, we have pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU - the engine of modern visual computing - the field has expanded to encompass video games, movie production, research, autonomous machines and Robotics.
The team is building a ground breaking robotics platform for developing the next generation of intelligent robots. NVIDIA’s ISAAC Robotics Platform is binding together high-fidelity visual and physical simulation, a high-quality developing platform, hundreds of optimized algorithms to tackle hard problems in computer vision and artificial intelligence, and a small and powerful computational platform to form the brain of intelligent machines.
What You’ll Be Doing:
As a member of our Robotics team, you will work on designing and building a state of art validation framework to auto validate DNN models, navigation stack and other robotics algorithms in simulated and real environments.
Create innovative ways to define validation scenarios and measure KPIs of robotics software in terms of functionality and performance.
Required excellent coding skills to create the entire framework.
Design framework to track, monitor and improve robotics functionality and performance via Dashboards.
Architect and design for high performance, scalability and availability. Framework should enable the running of robotics software and define success criteria at scale in cloud environments.
Work closely with Robotics, AI and validation experts to tune the framework for maximum efficiency.
What We Need to See:
BS, MS, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or equivalent.
8+ of industry experience in relevant technologies.
Hands-on experience working with simulators, designing and building validation frameworks for machine learning & deep learning, autonomous vehicles or robotics stack, and working with cloud technologies.
Excellent data analysis skills and hold on scripting languages .
Demonstrate excellent C++, Python or Go programming, software design using modular approach and use of data structures.
Passion to work with open source.
Strong oral and written communication skills are required.
Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:
Have developed automated frameworks for creating, executing procedures that validate and verify perception capabilities for autonomous vehicles or robotics including individual software modules, subsystems and functionality.
Solid understanding and working experience with running simulators on cloud environments and scaling applications using cloud.

NVIDIA is looking for outstanding engineers to accelerate the world's machine learning workloads. We're building deep integration between NVIDIA's GPU-backed RAPIDS frameworks and all of the major cloud and on-premise machine learning platforms. This is a chance to get into the guts of the latest technologies and speed up critical ML jobs by 50x or more.
We’re an interdisciplinary team, so you should expect to work directly with top experts in GPU programming and machine learning, while leading efforts to improve performance, scaling, and usability in these platforms. This is a distributed team, so you’re welcome to come into an NVIDIA office (once quarantine ends!) Or to work from home full time.
What you'll be doing:
Optimizing integration between RAPIDS machine learning libraries into popular cloud machine learning and data processing frameworks
Building bridges between RAPIDS and major distributed computing and hyperparameter optimization packages
Benchmarking and resolving performance issues
Developing reference architectures and recipes for scale-out ML in the cloud
Optionally, presenting at conferences and in webinars
What we need to see:
Strong programming skills, especially in Python with 10+ years of relevant experience in a programming intensive role.
MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related fields
Experience with distributed computing platforms, particularly Kubernetes or the Hadoop/Spark ecosystem
Experience building and deploying containers
Familiarity with major cloud computing services
Great debugging and problem-solving skills

Good C/C++ coding experience
Core machine learning skills (also a good opportunity to learn those if you're not familiar yet)
Familiarity with CUDA and GPU programming (if you know it, great, if not - we're happy to teach you!)
High-performance networking knowledge - e.g. previous work with Infiniband or Ethernet in an HPC or distributed training context
Empathy for downstream users and a desire to make their work smoother and more efficient

Job Summary Are you a passionate and innovative wireless communication engineer looking to research and develop state-of-the-art 5G technologies for defense applications? Do you excel at solving complex and critical challenges that can define our future? Senior Python Engineer - 63641
Technology and Engineering - USA Chicago, Illinois

We are looking for
A Senior Python Engineer to work on the Intelligence Studio team to continue scaling this application to meet internal and external demand.
We use cutting edge technology and industry-leading data science to tackle some of the hardest problems in marketing science. We’re automating our models with artificial intelligence and machine learning to produce the same quality insights as a traditional white-glove consulting engagement at unparalleled speed and scale.

So what specifically is Intelligence Studio, you ask, and why is it so cool? Intelligence Studio is a horizontally scalable, cross-cloud technology-agnostic platform built with trusted open source components like Kubernetes, Spark, Airflow, MLflow, and TensorFlow. It allows data scientists to focus on doing data science by taking care of essential concerns like data access, logging, configuration, resource negotiation, dependency management, orchestration, and testing.
This self-service, data science platform solution connects in with partners in a shared ecosystem, scales by usage, and has the building blocks to help our data scientists and clients move from creation to deployment of a data science project, at scale.

Interested in what your project will be? Read on!
Recently, we implemented a multi-user cloud-based integrated development environment with code completion and debugging built-in. And now we’re focused on building a fine-grained entitlements and access control system for big data.
This position is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced engineer to work with creative engineers and cutting-edge technologies, so we need hands-on technologists who are strong in software engineering fundamentals, Big Data, and DevOps. And did we mention the cold brew on tap? You’ll also get all the free coffee (hot or cold) you can want, all day long.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
Building software and integrations in a cloud-based Microservices environment for Big Data applications
Actively participate in team code reviews and enforce quality standards
Work within a cross-functional team to author clear and purposeful epics/stories
Promote and enforce best practices in development and operations
Identify opportunities and weaknesses in the platform architecture

WE ARE LOOKING FOR PEOPLE WITH:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent industry experience
5-7+ years of software development experience, preferably in an agile development environment
Strong experience in Python development
It would be great if you also have experience with Scala, Flask, Big Data or cloud technologies, but this isn’t required. We also use cloud software design, containerized Microservices & distributed caching, but you can learn this if you aren’t familiar with it.
#LI-VP1
ABOUT NIELSEN
We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.
We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. Trepp is searching for an individual to join our Technology Group as a Senior Data Infrastructure Engineer. We are looking for someone excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company's data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives. We provide a collaborative team environment where our technologists work closely with product and subject matter experts in addition to other technology team members and are empowered to impact the organization through leadership, creativity, and innovation.

The Data Engineering Group at Trepp is responsible for processing data from numerous vendors, information providers, and data sources and pipelining this data to our newly formed data lake, and further downstream applications. The team will be responsible for existing pipelines and systems while simultaneously developing new data services. This team, combined with our Product Groups are always thinking of new products and ways to deliver information to our clients to make our tools and applications easier to use, and better integrate with customer workflows.

We value being able to think up new solutions to problems and be able to develop prototypes and POCs to validate ideas quickly. You will be challenged to think creatively for the best solutions to any given project.

Responsibilities:
Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations

Architect the services and infrastructure to democratize data across our products, APIs, data science team and customers.

Determine optimal solutions for integrating data from a variety of sources for projects and migrating data to central Data Lake

Comfortable being given clear project goals & objectives, and being empowered for discovering optimal solutions.

You have a strong preference for automation and making tasks easy and repeatable. Single use scripts and one-off tasks are best to be avoided.

Required Skills:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent (advanced degree preferred)

8-10 years of professional programming experience working in engineering departments developing in Java, Python, node.js, or equivalent.

Deep experience with Cloud services such as Lake Formation, RDS, Elasticache, EMR

Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets

Experience using big data technologies, such as Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch, Logging & Analysis Systems

Strong knowledge of relational SQL and noSQL databases

Experience in designing and developing the fault-tolerant and scalable distributed systems

Strong documentation skills (Markdown, you like GitHub READMEs), and the ability to communicate requirements to other team members and project stakeholders.

Preferred Skills:
A drive to work on financial data systems & pipelines and improve them through the usage of Cloud Architectures

Working knowledge of scheduling tools like Airflow, AWS Batch, Luigi, etc.

Knowledge of entitlements and Authorization systems to manage data and API access

Financial Services, Artificial Intelligence and/or Machine Learning

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Trepp (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

About Trepp

Trepp, LLC, founded in 1979, is the leading provider of information, analytics and technology to the CMBS, commercial real estate and banking markets. Trepp provides primary and secondary market participants with the web-based tools and insight they need to increase their operational efficiencies, information transparency and investment performance. Trepp serves its clients with products and services to support trading, research, risk management, surveillance and portfolio management. Trepp is wholly-owned by DMG Information, a division of the Daily Mail and General Trust (DMGT).

All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and other status protected by applicable laws.

Are you interested in working for one of the most exciting products at Microsoft to help advance Microsoft’s AI Platform? Are you excited about being part of a product group working with Microsoft researchers, data scientists and AI engineering teams to ensure success as they move forward with cloud computing in Azure? If so, then look no further than the AI Platform team. AI Platform is responsible for the Azure Machine Learning (Azure ML) and Cognitive Services products.

Azure ML is building the machine learning development platform that makes it easy for all data scientists and AI developers to create and deploy robust and highly scalable ML and AI solutions in the cloud using the best of the open source ecosystem and innovation from inside the company along with the latest breakthroughs in research.

Artificial intelligence (AI) is dramatically transforming people’s work and life now, and Cognitive Services bring AI within reach of every developer—without requiring machine-learning expertise. All it takes is an API call to embed the ability to see, hear, speak, search, understand, and accelerate decision-making into your apps.
We are hiring engineers who are passionate about building scalable, distributed, highly available, and secure cloud services for Microsoft AI Platform. We value creativity and a desire to learn new technologies, agility and accountability.

Join our team and help us build the best AI Platform for the world!
Responsibilities
As a member of our team, you will participate in developing innovative solutions across AI Platform. Responsibilities include the following.
Write concise and clean code with unit tests
Build scalable, high-performance services that are highly reliable
Design and implement new features as well as add functionality to existing systems
Investigate pre-production and production issues, implement and deploy fixes
Participate in an on-call rotation (typically 24/7 for one week every 6-8 weeks)
Being enthusiastic, self-motivated, and a great collaborator
Being passionate about making customers successful
Qualifications
Qualifications:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical experience is required.
At least 8 years of software development experience in C#, Java, Scala, C++, Go, Python or similar languages.
Solid Computer Science fundamentals, fluent in multi-threaded programming, experience/inclination for architecting at scale
Demonstrated technical design, problem solving, coding and debugging skills
Experience with distributed systems design and implementation, especially microservices architecture, and Kubernetes, Linux, and related technologies is a plus
Good written and oral communication skills
Security Clearance Requirements:
Citizenship Verification: This position requires verification of US Citizenship to meet federal government security requirements
Candidates must have an active TS and be willing to upgrade to TS/SCI (with polygraph) or have an active TS/SCI and be willing to upgrade to TS/SCI (with polygraph). This role will require candidates to maintain the TS/SCI (with polygraph) clearance.
Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Business Group Highlights

Intelligence

The Intelligence group provides high-end systems engineering and integration products and services, data analytics and software development to national and military intelligence customers. Serving federal agencies and the Intelligence Community for more than 50 years, the Intelligence group helps our clients meet their mission needs by providing trusted advisors, leading-edge technologies, and innovative solutions.

Responsibilities

The Challenge: Are you looking for an opportunity to make a difference in the government space? Do you enjoy being both a project manager and a technical enthusiast at heart? What if you could find a position that is tailor-made for your mix of development, engineering, and communication skills? That's why we need you, a proven leader, to help us shorten the time it takes to get critical tools developed and into the hands of warfighters who need them and to quickly provide assistance and aid to the people who need it. As a senior engineer, you will be an integral member of a contractor team which provides the software and infrastructure support to both legacy and new/emerging technologies. You will be a part of the Govt Program Management Office as a SETA and will be asked to support the customer’s desire to provide mission with solutions. You will have frequent and direct interface with senior customers.

Let us help you in building your career while you provide mission critical support to the warfighter. When you join Perspecta, you can expect a culture that focuses on supporting our employees, as well as opportunities that provide stability while offering variety. You'll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources to further continuous learning. We will also take care of you financially, by providing a benefits package that is unmatched and puts money back into your paycheck. Let us pay a significant portion of your medical, dental and vision premiums, as well as give you extra PTO days and a monetary bonus once a year (on top of regular salary increases)!

What we need from you:
To be who you are: an energetic, forward leaning, self-starter visionary!
Holds a positive outlook
Strong customer intimacy skills
Knowledge of current IT solutions such as AWS, Google, Containerization, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, etc
Knowledge of infrastructure configuration practices and software engineering best practices
Knowledge or experience in implementing DevOps
SAFe or Agile experience/certification
Demonstrated ability to work and quickly transition across multiple tasks
Expert representational, oral, and written communication skills, including the ability to produce clear, logical, and concise products;
Superior organizational and interpersonal skills, and demonstrated ability to interface effectively via written and oral forums with personnel at all levels of government;
Demonstrated capability and success working in team environments with multiple subcontractors

Qualifications
Requires active TS/SCI with poly and 12 to 15 years with BS/BA or 10 to 13 years with MS/MA or 7 to 9 years with Ph.D
Hold an active TS/SCI clearance (with Poly preferred)
Understand Systems Engineering including requirements, architecture, and verification/validation (V&V) process
Systems Engineering experience on large complex systems
Acquisition experience on small to large systems
Project management and acquisition management
Understanding of programmatic processes, including configuration management, risk and readiness
Understanding and experience implementing a CI/CD pipeline
About Perspecta

What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. At Perspecta, everything we do, from conducting innovative research to cultivating strong relationships, supports one imperative: ensuring that your work succeeds. Our company was formed to bring a broad array of capabilities to all parts of the public sector—from investigative services and IT strategy to systems work and next-generation engineering.

Our promise is simple: never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. And with a workforce of approximately 14,000, more than 48 percent of which is cleared, we have been trusted to just that, as a partner of choice across the entire sector.

We are now looking for a Senior Physical Design Engineer ! Are you interested in defining the next generation of Hardware for Artificial Intelligence ? Are you passionate about designing products that have wide-ranging applications in multiple fields? Then NVIDIA is the place for you!
We are part of the global circuits team at NVIDIA that design the state-of-the-art GPUs for all applications such as supercomputers, gaming consoles and self driving cars. Our team's focus is on crafting creative circuits to improve system level performance, power and security. Come join us in our mission to Engineer the next generation of world-class products.
What you will do:
In this role, You will participate in groundbreaking Processor design in deep submicron technologies.
You'll work as part of a global circuits team to design innovative circuits for adaptive clocking and security solutions
Help drive the physical implementation of semi-custom circuit IP using custom and automated tools
Collaborate and work closely with circuit designers to improve the power, performance and area utilization of the next generation GPUs.
What we need to see:
BSEE (MS preferred) in Electrical or Computer Engineering with 5 years of demonstrated ability.
Good understanding of Place and Route design tools and methodologies.
Should be a strong power user of P&R, Timing analysis and Physical verification CAD tools from Synopsys(ICC2/PT/STAR-RC/ICV) and Cadence(Innovus/Tempus).
You should have prior experience in timing closure, clock/power distribution and analysis of successful taped-out designs.
Proficiency in scripting language, such as, Perl, Tcl, Make and automation methods/algorithms is required.
Understanding of deep submicron process issues is a plus.
Recent circuit design experience and understanding with running spice is a definite plus.
Understanding of timing and power modeling of standard cells, RAMs, and custom circuits required.
Prior leadership experience is a plus.
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, a related specialized area or field is required (or equivalent experience) plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Imagine a world-class engineering environment. Now add a team of exceptional talent along with technologies that are so advanced they’re often classified. That’s what you’ll find at General Dynamics Mission Systems. Here you’ll lead amazing engineers as they invent the technologies, products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. If you want the chance to lead, it’s time to bring your talent to General Dynamics Mission Systems.

We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.

General Dynamics Mission Systems has an immediate opening for an Electrical Design Engineer (RF). This position provides an opportunity to further advance the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nation’s core defense/intelligence services and systems. General Dynamics Mission Systems employees work closely with esteemed customers to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions.

REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES AND TASKS:
Performs design and development in such areas as electrical, electromagnetic, electromechanical and software for production, transmission, measurement, and use of systems, instruments and controls

Leads the development of strategic tasks or small projects by applying engineering and organizational knowledge and expertise to achieve technical goals

Understands and interprets the technical, organizational and process aspects of the tasks assigned and can relate them to the technical needs of the overall project or organization

Plans and executes small projects or task elements within larger projects, organizations, or for groups of projects

Responsible for the completion of assigned engineering tasks or small projects within budgetary and scheduling guidelines

Actively uncovers technical and organizational risks and ensures they are included in risk mitigation plans

Participates in development of program strategies and teaming strategies as they relate to the assigned task

Participates in the proposal process

Participates in feasibility studies and testing on new and modified designs

Carries out other tasks, not listed, assigned by supervisor

Travel will be required.

SPECIFIC DUTIES AND TASKS:
Assist with legacy radome system production and testing

Assist with proposal development, specification negotiation, radome design and radome performance analysis for new projects in areas of RF performance, lightning protection and low observables

Provide expertise in addressing production problems and repairs

Develop test plans, procedures and data processing tools for radome testing

Technical writing for formal engineering reports including qualification and acceptance reports

Develop and present radome design, performance and test data for customer reviews

Participate in radome qualification testing.

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
A strong background in mathematics and statistics

Experience and coursework that support a fundamental understanding of electromagnetics

Strong foundation and experience in programming using one or more of the following: FORTRAN, LabView, C++ or Python

The ability to carry out analysis of systems, particularly radar and communication systems.

PREFERRED SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Experience with modeling and predicting performance of RF windows

Experience with programming of motion control systems and / or microwave test equipment

Experience with development and executing electromagnetic solvers

An understanding of statistical methods in process control

Experience acting as Principal Investigator for Independent Research and Development (IRAD) projects

Ability to fulfill the technical lead position of customer-funded radome programs

PREFERRED DEGREE TYPES AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited program with emphasis on electromagnetics. Master's Degree is preferred.

Design or test experience with antennas and/or radomes.

LOCATIONS:
The successful candidate will join the team of engineering professionals in our Composite Solutions facility in Marion, Virginia. This position offers the flexibility to work out of the General Dynamics Mission Systems offices located in the Virginia Tech Corporate Research Center COgro facility in Blacksburg, Virginia.

Attractions in Southwest Virginia

Southwest Virginia offers scenic parks, recreation trails, historic towns, rich arts and culture, and numerous opportunities for outdoor activities and adventures.

Parks including Grayson Highlands State Park which provides access to the Appalachian Trail and the Virginia Highlands Horse Trail. The Hungry Mother State Park just outside the town of Marion offers a 108-acre lake, fishing, beach, campgrounds, and hiking trails.

The Virginia Creeper Trail which runs 34.3 miles from historic Abingdon to Whitetop Station, near the North Carolina border.

Numerous horseback trails that provide access to some of Southwest Virginia’s most stunning high country, including 200 miles of equestrian trails in the Mount Rogers National Recreation Area, the 68-mile Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, and nearly 10 miles of riding trails in Grayson Highlands State Park (with overnight facilities for campers with horses).

The Barter Theatre in Abingdon, VA and the Lincoln Theatre in Marion, VA.

Birthplace of Country Music Museum in Bristol, VA.

There is flexibility to work out of the GDMS offices located in the Virginia Tech Corporate Research Center COgro facility in Blacksburg, Virginia.

job_title: Sr Systems Engineer II - Modeling & Simulation
job_description:
Raytheon’s engineers develop the next generation of defense technologies that support our military and protect our nation and our allies. We are the world’s leader in developing and manufacturing leading edge missile systems and defense solutions, and we are looking for engineers who enjoy solving complex problems and engaging in a dynamic team environment.


The efforts of the Modeling and Simulation Engineers of Raytheon Missiles & Defense allows the customer to experiment with and develop new complex weapon systems in a simulation-driven virtual environment. We create battlefield simulations, detailed hardware and environment models, perform pre and post flight analysis, physics based modeling, integrate flight software, run time optimization, computer and hardware-in-the-loop integration, and investigate military product value. Our department’s engineers are versatile, innovative, self-motivated and eager to learn.

Our Huntsville, AL, location has openings available for Modeling and Simulation Engineers to join our team of engineering professionals, specifically for shaping and supporting complex systems in the early development phase. Learn more and apply today!

U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance as of day one of employment.

Job Description and Key Tasks:

The Senior Systems Engineer II will work across multiple disciplines (e.g. Guidance, Navigation, and Control, signal processing, mechanical design) to design and develop multiple fidelities of simulation models which represent the components of a system. This includes showcasing the ability to read, debug, edit and create computer programming code to enhance simulation models, creating and executing unit tests on the models to verify functionality, documenting the design and test results, and integrating with other component models in a complex system simulation environment. This may also include development of interfaces to support Computer and Hardware-in-the-Loop capabilities within the simulation framework.
The Senior Systems Engineer II will execute simulations in a high-performance computing environment, which can include the use of Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), to support missile system design/trade studies, performance assessment, and system test. The Senior/Principal Simulation Engineer will develop analysis of the data for the specific task as well as provide detailed insight and understanding of the system performance, recognizing and troubleshooting any anomalies observed in the simulation results.
The Senior Systems Engineer II will assist in the preparation of detailed simulation plans, which may include developing task objectives, determining expected output, budget requirements and developing the Integrated Master Schedule (IMS). The Senior/Principal Simulation Engineer may interact with government counterparts as an authority on simulation products and may work at the customer site to assist with execution of the simulation and analyze the results.
Please note: We are not seeking engineers with an AutoCAD or 3-D modeling background or network modeling from an IT perspective.

Required Education, Experience & Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Physics, Math, or Computer Science
Six (6) years of applied work experience programming in a compiled language, such as C++, Java, or Fortran (C++ preferred)
Six (6) years professional experience developing software models of physical systems, physics, and/or hardware environments related to systems components
Experience using tools such as MATLAB or Python for data analysis
Experience using UNIX/Linux based workstations
Experience using EO/IR or radar scene generation capabilities
U.S. Citizenship is required.

Other Requirements:
Must have an existing Department of Defense issued Secret Security clearance.
Must be willing to relocate to Huntsville, AL (comprehensive relocation package available)
Desired Experience & Skills:
Advanced Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Physics, or Math
Experience developing applications using Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence
Leadership experience managing others as a technical lead, team lead or similar lead role involving applied system engineering and analysis
Experience in radar, signal & image processing, digital communications, estimation theory, optimal control, system architecture, inertial navigation, or guidance theory
Experience with simulation development in a Computer-in-the-Loop or Hardware-in-the-Loop environment
Strong problem solving skills and the ability to analyze and understand overall system performance to aid in model integration and troubleshooting
Knowledge of Software Configuration Management tools (Github, Subversion, Rational Team Concept, Synergy)
Practical experience with Earned Value Management System (EVMS), major Gates cycles (Preliminary Design Review, Critical Design Review, etc), and/or proposal and Basis of Estimates development
