job_title: Senior Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Specialist
job_description:
Our professionals balance analytical skills, deep market insight and independence to deliver solid, defensible analysis and practical advice to our clients. As an organization, we think globally. We create transparency in an opaque world, and we encourage our people to do the same. That means when you take your place on our team, you’ll discover a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel. If you’re ready to share your perspective with the world, then you can make a real impact here. This is the Duff & Phelps difference.

Duff & Phelps is building an artificial intelligence and machine learning practice, and we’re looking for you to join our growing portfolio of AI projects. You will be involved in developing advanced financial machine learning algorithms and working with an advanced engineering team and professionals from the world’s largest financial institutions, law enforcement, and government agencies.

At Duff & Phelps, your work will help protect, restore and maximize value for our clients. Join us and together we’ll maximize the value of your career.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Working with business analysts and engineers to understand the requirements
Machine Learning model building, training, validation and tuning
Explore & Visualize the data to gain better insights and identifying differences in data distribution to address the model performance challenges
Researching, evaluating and exploring various ML algorithms
Validating model inputs/ outputs & accuracy
Deploying models to production
Working with India and U.S.-based teams to deliver models
REQUIREMENTS:
STEM degree
Experience with Machine Leaning algorithms – supervised & unsupervised
Experience dealing with both structured & unstructured datasets and drawing the insights from the data
Good understating of the statistical methods – sampling, modelling, hypothesis testing & probability
Working experience with Python & ML libraries like Tensorflow, PyTorch, H2O or Keras
Experience with text analytics & NLP libraries
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work with an international team
DESIRED SKILLS:
Experience with cloud technologies (especially Azure) & APIs
Agile development experience
“Data Driven” decision making
In order to be considered for a position at Duff & Phelps, you must formally apply via careers.duffandphelps.jobs


Duff & Phelps is committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We will not discriminate between applications for reason of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.

Who We Are:

We are a group of self-starters who’ve developed one of the most powerful analytics platforms for tracking sponsorship ROI, media-value exposure, and audience behavioral shifts. We are a rapidly growing SaaS company with a client roster that includes over 200 esports and sports teams, brands, and agencies.

Who Are We Looking For (We Hope It's You):


We are looking for a Senior .NET Engineer with a passion for solving coding, machine learning / AI and automation challenges.

You’re a great fit if…


You have a passion for designing, building and maintaining high-quality software that answers the demands of a growing business
You enjoy solving challenging problems and good knowledge of DevOps tools.
You want to work in a fast-paced but fun startup environment with a tight-knit and talented team


What You'll Do @Zoomph (Code Away):


4+ years of experience working with .NET Framework / Core (C# and .NET)
Experience using JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as Node.js, AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, and ReactJS
Experience building APIs and background services leveraging cloud providers i.e. Amazon Web Services or Azure
Experience working with SQL and relational databases
Experience working with Agile methodologies
Experience with unit, integration, and end-to-end testing


We Really Love You If (Bonus Points):


Experience with ElasticSearch and RabbitMQ
Experience with .Net Core
Experience with DevOps and Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Experience with Automation, ML, Artificial Intelligence Services (AWS, GCP, and Azure)


Zoomph Provides:


Competitive salary, and equity incentive plan
Excellent health, dental and vision insurance
Fun, competitive, and passionate team in the heart of Reston, Virginia

At Pony.ai, excellence is at the core of our company. Every detail counts as we work to deliver a safe, reliable, and cost-effective autonomous driving platform to the public. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in developing and deploying state-of-the-art vehicle technology. You will have every opportunity to grow and develop as our company grows. Join us on this exciting journey as we bring the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence to the future of transportation.
As a senior electrical hardware engineer, you are responsible for:
Designing effective and reliable hardware architecture solutions for computing, sensing and control embedded systems;
Define and execution of hardware validation test plan;
Evaluating emerging new hardware technologies.
Requirements
Design experience of reliable electrical system from concept through launch
Knowledge of computation processor (CPU, GPU, FPGA, ISP or SoC) and computer architecture
Schematic design experience on embedded systems and IO interfaces
Strong EE knowledge about digital and analog circuits
Knowledge of power distribution network
Hands-on experience with an oscilloscope, signal generator, and other debug tools
Familiarity with automotive electro-mechanical system is a plus
Experience with Linux kernel, embedded software development, C/C++, python or other scripting languages is a plus
Minimum of a Masters Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent with 3+ years experience

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: C++ Developer
LOCATION: Orlando FL
US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.
Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.
The Role: C++ Software Engineer
We are looking to bring on one or more additional C++ Developers to work on our primary back end applications that include custom Artificial Intelligence (AI) engine, military modeling and simulation framework (M&S), and integration capabilities for our own front end and for 3rd party systems. This system leverages a range of communication protocols, complex data structures and algorithms, GIS & geometric concepts, and high performance optimizations to support a growing range of use cases. You will be expanding our core AI and M&S frameworks to support new domains (from ground forces to ballistic missiles), use cases (from analysis to real-time wargaming), fidelity of modeling of real world environments and entities, and AI-enabled tactics generation. You will also be integrating our software with other M&S systems, military C2 and Intelligence systems, and supporting varied computing environments (from containers in the cloud to embedded computer in a combat vehicle).
You will take part in design of new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of the software changes using C++ with constant focus on performance and optimization, model military concepts in software, work closely with front end software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find user centric ways to integrate our systems.
Key Experience to Have
Professional, enterprise grade, C++ Software Development experience
Development for Windows OS
Performance Optimization
Data Structures and Algorithms
Great Experience to Have
Modeling & Simulation (M&S)
GIS & Mapping
Geometric algorithms
Mercurial, Git, SVN
CI/CD, Jenkins
Docker & Kubernetes
Linux
Military concepts and tactics
Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, and other languages
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.

Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance.
We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share information with you once we are in discussions.
US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.
Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

La Jolla Logic (LJL) is an advanced technology and information system security solutions firm founded in 2011 in San Diego, CA. LJL's mission is to pioneer innovative, high-quality and best value specialty technology and engineering services to customers in the federal government and commercial marketplace.
We are an SBA Certified 8(a) Woman-Owned Small Business, awarded San Diego’s WOSB of the Year 2019 by the US SBA, and the SBA District Director’s Technology Sector Award in 2018. LJL has a reputation for performance to the highest standard, specializing in high-end cybersecurity engineering solutions, to include Machine Learning Technology, Artificial Intelligence R&D, Secure Enterprise Architecture Design, Cross Domain Solutions (CDS) , DoD Cloud Architecture development and deployment (AWS, Azure), Structured Data Models and Inference Engine Technology, System Security Engineering and System Accreditations (RMF & DIACAP), Advanced Technology Concept Development and Feasibility Assessments, Information Systems Security Manager/Officer (ISSM/ISSO) Services, and NIST 800-171 Compliance.
We are looking for a Full-Time Virtualization Design Engineer (Senior) to join our growing team to support Navy’s Next Generation Enterprise Networks newly awarded contract (NGEN-R) to provide Service Management, Integration and Transport (SMIT). The effort involves digital modernization of the Navy and Marine Corps enterprise networks for the next 8 years! Multiple locations across CONUS available.
Responsibilities may include:
Assist the Government Lead in the daily engineering duties on systems. Design, implement, and support the network to include installation, maintenance, security, and day-to-day monitoring of virtual infrastructure.
Maintain and administer applications, custom monitors, and custom reports. Coordinate and manage overall system maintenance. Recommend and implement test sets to provide root cause analysis and resolution for alerts and events and resolve incidents in response to escalated tickets.
Work with cluster file systems and other technologies to provide redundancy and availability for server farms and applications.
Develop and execute software, testing, and validation procedures, programming and documentation.
Design and customize software to optimize operational efficiency in cloud-based environments.
Develop and integrate virtual storage console. Execute data store design and management. Support virtualization capacity, performance design, and management.
Manage virtualization high availability/disaster recovery solution design and integration. Complete Virtual Switching (Vswitch) design and configuration.
Perform tasks associated with application networking ports and protocols, Information Assurance (IA), routing and Local Area Network (LAN). Manage user and group permissions and security design. Initiate security updates in accordance with Government procedures for directory services.
Support evaluating virtualization and network consolidation.
Perform virtualization integration with System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) 2012, SQL 2012R2, external storage devices utilizing LUNs, quota distribution and file sharing and installation on various server hardware.
Perform system integration with Host Based Security System (HBSS). Perform virtualization integration with New File System (NFS), IP Small Computer System Interface (iSCSI) and Fiber Channel (FC).
QUALIFICATIONS:
The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:
Minimum of ten (10) years experience
Experience with Data Sharing, Network Attached Storage (NAS), Disaster Recovery preparation, and integration of capabilities with Cloud Computing and Cyber architectures.
Experience with administering the most current versions of Windows Operating Systems and Windows Operating Systems environments, virtual infrastructure platforms, and working with vendor-neutral virtual networking solutions and technologies. Experience with virtualization concepts, virtual and storage networking protocols, such as Fiber Channel protocols and Internet Small Computer System Interface (iSCSI).
Experience with VMWare and Hyper-V tools and VMWare Update Manager.
Experience with Hyper-V WSUS (Windows Server Update Services).
Must possess Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) version 3 Foundation.
Must possess professional-level certifications in one or more technology related vendor solutions such as Veritas, EMC Corporation, NetApp, or Tivoli, or demonstrate sufficient experience in lieu of certification.
Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business, or related field
Information Assurance Technician (IAT) Level III Certification (CASP, CISP, or equivalent)
Active Secret Clearance at minimum
U.S. Citizenship is required

Preferred Experience with:
VMWare
Hyper-V tools
VMWare Update Manager
WSUS (Windows Server Update Services)
System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) 2012
SQL 2012R2

For more information about us, please visit our webpage at:
www.lajollalogic.com
La Jolla Logic is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Software Security and Quality business is all about building secure software—faster. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain. All while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. To find out more about SIG, Synopsys check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html.

Software Engineer, Sr I

The Static Analysis team is looking for an exceptional C/C++ developer to join the Coverity team. The job involves the creation of new code checkers, evolving Coverity's state-of-the-art analysis infrastructure, optimizing multi-process and system code, and generally pushing the envelope of static analysis.

This position is ideal if you

Enjoy reasoning abstractly and scientifically about programming languages and software systems.
Want to enable customers to find critical security vulnerabilities before they go live.
Have a desire to quickly familiarize yourself with a broad variety of languages and technologies.

The perfect candidate will have a strong passion for improving software quality and security and preferably have a background in programming languages and static analysis, and foremost a strong desire to learn. If you have experience with any other static analysis and developer testing tools like Fortify, Parasoft, Klocwork, or Checkmarx, we'd love to talk to you!

General Responsibilities

Design, experiment with, and implement new checkers
Make improvements to general analysis infrastructure
Investigate, debug, and reproduce failures and imprecision

Key Qualifications

Experience in C/C++ development (5+ years)
Experience with Object Oriented programming and design
Experience with development on Linux

Preferred Experience

Experience or Interest with WebApp Security or Mobile Security
Experience with one or more of Java, C#, JavaScript, Go, or Python
Experience with compiler technology
Research, degree or background in programming languages and static analysis
Experience with development on Windows

Education & Certifications

BA, BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

NVIDIA is seeking a Software Engineer passionate about Manipulation and Robotics to help drive the development and engineering activities directly related to productizing our robotics platform - Isaac.
For two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU we also set the stage for advances in the field of medical research, computer vision and artificial intelligence. Today NVIDIA is at the groundbreaking level to innovate robotics and intelligent autonomous machines. There has never been a more exciting time to join our company and team.
The team around Project Isaac is building tools and algorithms to teach the next generation of intelligent and autonomous robots. Isaac is binding together high-fidelity simulation, perception and planning algorithms, machine learning to Jetson, a small and powerful computational platform to form the brain of intelligent machines. Our team is diversified and spreading all over the world and over dozens of technological fields, and together we want to change the way robots are programmed.
What you’ll be doing:
Build tools and libraries enabling collaborative robots for manipulation and navigation
In collaboration with the product team, participate to Isaac SDK Human-machine interaction roadmap
Design teaching scenario using simulation technologies
Work with customers on developing architectures and solutions around collaborative manipulation
Collaborate with research teams to implement state of the art papers in Isaac's production code base
What we need to see:
Minimum requirement of BS or MS, 3+ years of relevant experience
Outstanding programming skills in C++, C, and/or Python
Experience taking projects from Research to Productization
Expert in code review and production code
You have excellent interpersonal skills
Experience in manipulation or perception algorithms
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
CUDA and proficiency in modern deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch is a plus.
Exposure to robotics or similar autonomous machine development
Project management tools (e.g. JIRA, Microsoft Project)
You have a thirst and ability to learn and adapt to new technologies
Flexibility/adaptability for working in a dynamic environment with different frameworks and requirements
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people on the planet working for us. If you're creative, autonomous, and passionate about autonomous machines - we would love to hear from you!
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Our mission is to protect life.
We’re out to make the world a safer place by solving big problems and taking on the public safety challenges of our time. From our company's inception building the TASER device to a full suite of hardware and software solutions, we are focused on providing police agencies with the state-of-the-art devices and services they need to successfully serve and protect us. In the next few years, we're going to eliminate the burden of paperwork in policing, so officers can increase the time they spend building relationships and serving in their communities. We’ll put video at the heart of the police record so our justice system can get to the truth faster. And we won't stop innovating until the bullet is rendered obsolete.

It’s a big mission, but it’s one we’ll pursue relentlessly every single day.

Your Impact
Today, public safety officers spend up to 2/3 of their time on the job filling out paperwork. Not only is this tedious for officers, but the never-ending pile of paperwork reduces the amount of time they can spend out in the field, protecting their communities. That’s why we’re building Axon Records, a brand-new cloud-based web platform that cuts down on paperwork so that officers can spend more time prioritizing the safety of our communities.

As a Senior Software Engineer on the Axon Records Search team, you will build a high-performance, scalable search platform to equip law enforcement officers with the information they need to document critical incidents, report their interactions, and protect their communities. And that’s just the beginning. By building a data analytics platform to gather real-time insights from criminal data to help agencies solve crimes and keep patrol officers safe in the field, you will help transform the future of public safety.

Imagine the year 2030. Advanced technology has automated more and more routine tasks to put officers back in the community, dramatically improving the quality and safety of our lives. Artificial Intelligence connects the dots and surfaces insights to help prevent crime and keep officers and citizens informed and protected.

Sound exciting? We think so too. Check out this short video to learn more about where we're heading, and apply now to join a team that's turning this vision into a reality.
Your Day-to-Day
Design and implement new features for the next generation Records Management System
Build scalable backend services
Work closely with customers and design top-priority features
Mentor junior developers on the team
Basic Qualifications
A customer-obsessed developer with 5+ years of experience in launching and operating complex web applications
Proficient in HTML5, CSS, Javascript, and component-based frameworks like React.js
Backend service experience in languages, such as Go, Python, Java, or Scala
Experience with search engine technologies, such as Elasticsearch or Solr
Strong experience with databases, such as MySQL or Cassandra
Enjoys mentoring and growing junior engineers
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
Experience designing and delivering high-availability, scalable cloud-based systems
Experience with realtime streaming event log or messaging technologies, such as Kafka or ActiveMQ
Experience using metrics (e.g. DataDog, Splunk) to triage and investigate failure scenarios
Facilitates cross-team collaboration among engineers and contributes to the broader community of senior engineers
Influences peers, advises senior leaders, coaches and mentors junior team members]
Compensation and Benefits
Competitive salary and 401K with employer match
Discretionary paid time off
Robust parental leave policy
An award-winning office/working environment
Ride along with real police officers in real life situations, see them use technology, get inspired
And more...

job_title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer - Remote
job_description:
ABOUT US
Resilience360 (Wholly Owned by Rising Tide Digital) by enables companies to visualize, track, and mitigate risks in their supply chain. The Resilience360 suite of solutions enables intuitive visualization of supplier networks, tracks shipments across different modes and lanes, and permits near real-time monitoring of incidents capable of disrupting supply chains. Resilience360 provides companies a first mover advantage in detecting and verifying risks using both Artificial Intelligence and a human network of DHL employees in 220 countries and territories. Customers trust Resilience360 to ensure business continuity, identify critical hotspots to mitigate risks, and turn potential disruptions into a competitive advantage.
Born at the world's largest logistics company Deutsche Post DHL and now backed by Rising Tide Digital (RTD) and Columbia Capital, a Washington, DC-based venture capital group with a long history of investing in and scaling high growth and disruptive technology companies, Resilience360 offers a fast-paced, exciting opportunity for growth in the space of supply chain data and analytics.
POSITION OVERVIEW
RTD delivers operational supply chain insights based on data and predictive analytics. As a Full-Stack Engineer you will work within an agile team to develop and deploy applications and features that are used in customer-facing SaaS solutions for supply chain risk management. You will be using the latest in cloud-native technologies to deliver secure, highly-available solutions enabling RTD clients to reduce the volatility in their supply chain operations and increase the value of their businesses.
100% Remote Position
Responsibilities
Design and develop software to meet business requirements, perform unit tests, and fix bugs.
Scope of work will span front-end (UI/UX), back-end (APIs) and data stores.
Work closely with your team to define requirements and come up with technical solutions
Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve production issues
Create useful documentation for any tooling and services developed
Required Skills and Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
Ability to work collaboratively with on-site and remote teams
Experience meeting business needs with deliverables under tight deadlines.
3+ years of modern Python web development experience
Django
Celery
Postgresql
Redis
3+ years of front-end web development experience, including
HTML5, CSS / SASS
React
1+ years experience working delivering client-facing applications with AWS
3+ years experience with Linux / Ubuntu
Familiarity with OWASP
Bonus Skills
Experience with microservices and evented architectures.
Geospatial / GIS experience
Domain experience in Supply-Chain and/or the Transportation industry
Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity
We are committed to equal-employment principles, and we recognize the value of committed worksite employees who feel they are being treated in an equitable and professional manner. We strive to find ways to attract, develop and retain the talent needed to meet business objectives, and to recruit and employ highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities in which we live.

About us

Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.
To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.
National Grid is Hiring a Senior Analytics Software Engineer in our Hicksville, NY location.
Job Purpose

The Software Engineer is responsible for collaborating with the different stakeholders within the ADA team to design, develop, and test production level software to meet the advanced analytical business need. He/she will need to able to build application programming interfaces, integrate software with databases, program in an object-oriented manner, and package software for reusability by other software components. Development is expected to be cloud ready, taking full advantage of cloud services and tools that are necessary in the functional realm of advanced big data and analytics.
Key Accountabilities
Design, develop, and test software in the advanced analytical and big data discipline.
Collaborate with the Quantitative Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers and IS Operations team to enable the packaging, optimization and documentation of software to deploy it in production environment
Be able to troubleshoot/debug major issues as needed.
Work with the ADA team members and be able to anticipate future developmental requirements.
Be able to understand the business requirements that are requested in a project and translate them into technical specs and deliver actionable and scalable software solutions
Be able to facilitate discussions based on varying levels of technical expertise of the audience.
Develop set of guiding principles and best practices to enable Analytical model developers in developing production ready code.
Set the standard for managing source code in adopting version control best practices.
Being able to adapt to the changing priorities in the business and demonstrate flexibility in working on developing and supporting different software components.
Qualifications
Minimum bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics, applied computer science, applied management science or operations research.
Master’s degree in a computer science discipline is strongly preferred, with a background in computer programming and/or a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in advanced data processing and software development is desired.

job_title: Senior Operator Training Simulator Design Engineer
정리된 job_title: Senior Operator Training Simulator Design Engineer
job_description:
Location: Rockville, MD
Status: Full-time, Exempt
Hours: 8:00am-5:00pm, Mon-Fri

Position Description

Interfacing with all engineering disciplines and designers on the Project Team and with the client to ensure all client requirements are satisfied. Work on the development of the Xe-100 Operator Training Simulator Development & translation of the Distributed Control System. Works independently with minimal guidance using knowledge of thermodynamics, electrical/I&C engineering concepts. May provide guidance and direction to other employees to support production of high quality, timely and cost-effective engineering solutions to technical problems. Assist with the Burn Up Measurement System Development.

Responsibilities
Ensure the Functional Requirement and Procurement Specifications for instrumentation and control systems for nuclear power plants are met

Process instrumentation replacement evaluation reports and nuclear modification packages

Work on Mechatronics, Control Systems for pumps, valves, heat exchangers, steam turbines and reactors to improve the functionality of the client's plant

Attend client meetings and perform site walkdowns to ensure the client is satisfied with our work product

Provide guidance as a mentor in the development of less experienced nuclear instrumentation and controls design engineers

Assists Fix-it-Now (FIN) group within Maintenance to resolve plant issues

Develop troubleshooting plans and failure mode analysis documents to support investigations

Assist in Operations in resolving plant operational issues

Assist in Planning group in resolving work order planning issues for routine, non-routine & modification related work orders

Assist in Maintenance shop in resolving work group issues

Develops Operability Determinations & Functionality Assessments on plant systems / components

Assist in Plant Procedure group with procedure reviews, developing/ reviewing procedure 5059 and resolving procedure issues

Uses existing procedures to investigate, evaluate and assist in producing technically correct and cost-effective design changes or recommendations that solve ongoing problems

Directly interfaces with other workgroups (e.g., Station Engineering, FIN, Operations, Maintenance, Radiation Protection)

Builds relationships that will facilitate knowledge transfer, cross functional knowledge of related work groups, and ability to present work products effectively

Gathers and correlates basic engineering data using well defined engineering procedures, which may include routine and diagnostic testing of components and systems, and engineering studies to support plant troubleshooting

Assists in a variety of topics including developing innovative procedures, improved design recommendations or new or better equipment purchase recommendations

Preparation and review of design change packages and design calculations (e.g., load flow, short circuit, protective device coordination, etc.) in accordance with plant procedures

Competencies

Sound knowledge on the development of Operator Training Simulators

Sound knowledge and experience on Distributed Control Systems & Translation

Sound knowledge and experience on PID controllers and controller development

Ability to effectively manage and coordinate relevant interfaces between companies and departments

Basic understanding of nuclear engineering, licensing, regulatory, quality, and safety requirements

Good leadership skills including effective management skills (planning, organizing, coordinating, directing)

Excellent people skills – with peers, customers, staff, subcontractors

Good analytical and organizational problem-solving skills; lateral thinking skills

Decisive decision maker in difficult situations

Able to be independent, objective and impartial

Minimum Qualifications

BS degree in engineering from an ABET accredited program, with coursework focusing in instrumentation and process controls design engineering

A minimum of 5 years of experience in Operator Training Simulator Development & Distributed Control Systems; Experience in design engineering for nuclear power plant control system is preferred

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

PE license preferred, but not required

Minimum Experience/Knowledge

Competent in Operator Training Simulator Development

Competent in PID Controller design

Competent in Visio, SmartPlant, Microstation or equivalent software

Familiar with Flownex of SimuPact is an advantage

Familiar with Digital Twin Development is an advantage

Familiar with electrical design requirements for Nuclear Power plants

Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning Experience is an advantage

Experience in Mass & Heat Balance development and Power Station Design is an advantage

job_title: AI/ML - Sr Software Engineer, Siri Experience
job_description:
Summary
Posted: May 27, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200168853
Would you like to play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction? Come join the Siri team at Apple. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Build groundbreaking technology for artificial intelligence. Transform the way people keep up with the world and work with the people who crafted the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking. This team is looking to deliver the next generation of voice assistant technology to hundreds of millions of customers worldwide.
Key Qualifications
Strong Computer Science fundamentals including familiarity with algorithms, object-oriented programming, and design skills.
Strong object-oriented programming and design skills
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
Full stack development experience
3-6 years of professional/industry software engineering experience.
Description
The Siri team is looking for someone with a combination of strong programming skills and a creative, user-focused mindset. Additionally, someone who can analyze metrics and make data-driven decisions. You will be an outstanding teammate who can collaborate with engineers in several technical areas that have crafted the entire range of Siri's capabilities. You should be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment with rapidly changing priorities.
SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE
• Creating and implementing natural language interactions and work flow that provide intelligent user assistance
• Writing software across multiple domain areas, using client code and full stack systems
• Collaborating with cross functional teams to capture requirements, understand dependencies, define architecture, and implement solutions to well-defined projects
• Working with design and client-side teams to ensure a phenomenal user experience
Education & Experience
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.
Additional Requirements
Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

About Nauto

NautoⓇ is the only real-time AI-powered, Driver Behavior Learning Platform to predict, actively prevent, and reduce high-risk events in the mobility ecosystem. By analyzing billions of data points from over 400 million AI-processed video miles, Nauto’s machine learning algorithms continuously improve and impact driver behavior before events happen, not after. Nauto has enabled the largest commercial fleets in the world to avoid more than 25,000 collisions, resulting in nearly $100 million in savings.

Nauto is located in North America, Japan, and Europe. Nauto is backed by SoftBank Vision FundGroup Corp., Greylock Partners, BMW iVentures, General Motors Ventures, Toyota AI Ventures, Allianz Group, Playground Global and DNX Ventures.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Device Engineering team, you will be responsible for development of Java and Native (C++) Applications for Android as well as Linux Applications for the Nauto device platforms.
Your will be interacting with product managers to scope platform features, advise them on feasibility, provide estimations.
You will be working with hardware engineers to create Applications for the hardware being designed with hardware and deliver functionality for the platform.
You will own the delivery of your code from end-to-end, automating continuous integration and delivery.

Skills

You are self-motivated and driven with solid programming as well as Architecture and Design skills for delivering applications for embedded platforms
You have strong Android as well as Linux Application development skills.
7+ years excelling in software engineering roles with track record of successful delivery of production quality software for embedded and user facing mobile applications
BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or relevant technical field required, MS/PhD a plus
Strong experience in working with various sensors (IMU, camera, GPS, etc.) and implementing complex algorithms
Track record in published apps in Play store a big plus
Experience in computer vision and/or deep learning algorithms a plus

Perks

Ground floor opportunity with the team; shape the strategic direction of the company.
Beautiful modern workspace. Many perks including a cafe with meals, snacks, and drinks provided.
Exceptional health benefits coverage.
Opportunities to get to know your team better through frequent employee events and gatherings.
Sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment.
Learning and development opportunities from a highly diverse and talented peer group, including experts in a wide range of fields, from Artificial Intelligence & Computer Vision to Systems & Device Engineering to Support & Operations.

Come revolutionize transportation safety and do your best work here at Nauto!

Nauto is committed to being a diverse and inclusive environment that fosters learning from each other. We celebrate people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment free of harassment and discrimination.

To all recruitment agencies: Nauto does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Nauto employees or any other company location. Nauto is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About Nauto

NautoⓇ is the only real-time AI-powered, Driver Behavior Learning Platform to predict, actively prevent, and reduce high-risk events in the mobility ecosystem. By analyzing billions of data points from over 400 million AI-processed video miles, Nauto's machine learning algorithms continuously improve and impact driver behavior before events happen, not after. Nauto has enabled the largest commercial fleets in the world to avoid more than 25,000 collisions, resulting in nearly $100 million in savings.

Nauto is located in North America, Japan, and Europe. Nauto is backed by SoftBank Vision FundGroup Corp., Greylock Partners, BMW iVentures, General Motors Ventures, Toyota AI Ventures, Allianz Group, Playground Global and DNX Ventures.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Device Engineering team, you will be responsible for development of Java and Native (C++) Applications for Android as well as Linux Applications for the Nauto device platforms.
Your will be interacting with product managers to scope platform features, advise them on feasibility, provide estimations.
You will be working with hardware engineers to create Applications for the hardware being designed with hardware and deliver functionality for the platform.
You will own the delivery of your code from end-to-end, automating continuous integration and delivery.

Skills

You are self-motivated and driven with solid programming as well as Architecture and Design skills for delivering applications for embedded platforms
You have strong Android as well as Linux Application development skills.
7+ years excelling in software engineering roles with track record of successful delivery of production quality software for embedded and user facing mobile applications
BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or relevant technical field required, MS/PhD a plus
Strong experience in working with various sensors (IMU, camera, GPS, etc.) and implementing complex algorithms
Track record in published apps in Play store a big plus
Experience in computer vision and/or deep learning algorithms a plus

Perks

Ground floor opportunity with the team; shape the strategic direction of the company.
Beautiful modern workspace. Many perks including a cafe with meals, snacks, and drinks provided.
Exceptional health benefits coverage.
Opportunities to get to know your team better through frequent employee events and gatherings.
Sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment.
Learning and development opportunities from a highly diverse and talented peer group, including experts in a wide range of fields, from Artificial Intelligence & Computer Vision to Systems & Device Engineering to Support & Operations.

Come revolutionize transportation safety and do your best work here at Nauto!

We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment free of harassment and discrimination.

Senior Solution Engineer - West
San Francisco preferred; will consider other Western region flight hubs

RichRelevance, Inc. is the global leader in Experience Personalization, driving digital growth and brand loyalty for over 200 of the world’s largest B2C and B2B brands and retailers. Our SaaS solutions leverage advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technologies to bridge the experience gap between marketing and commerce through personalized content, offers and search. We help digital marketing leaders stage memorable experiences that speak to individual buyers – from their first click, at scale, in real time, and across the customer lifecycle.

Even before the “next normal”, when every day became a Black Friday and online commerce became the lifeblood of so many businesses, RichRelevance delivered over $35B in attributable sales to its customers by serving up the right experience, every time. RichRelevance serves customers in 44 countries from 9 offices around the globe. To learn more about how to change the way the world shops for the better with personalization with next generation AI, visit us at www.richrelevance.com.

Solution Engineers are the primary technical advisor and problem solver resource for our clients and the sales and account management teams. The Solution Engineer is responsible for:
Consulting with our existing and new customers to understand problems and challenges and provide solutions and plans accordingly.
Actively driving and managing the “technical win” within an active sales process,
Working in conjunction with the rest of the client facing team as the key technical advisor and advocate for our solutions and platform.
Dissecting complex client requirements and designing architecture with our technical components.


The Solution Engineer must be client facing and able to uncover challenges and needs that might not be obvious as well as articulate capabilities and product positioning to both business and technical users at all levels. The Solution Engineer must be able to establish and maintain strong relationships with both new prospects and existing clients.

All candidates must be self-motivated with a proven track record in enterprise software sales and knowledge either in SaaS technologies, ecommerce software and analytics / big data. Proficiency or focus on CDP (customer data platform) or site search technologies also a bonus.

They must be comfortable in the dynamic atmosphere of a technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base and changing technical landscape. They must think outside the box, possess strong presentation skills, and be able to communicate complex technical ideas to a range of business, marketing and IT user, both easily and professionally.

Responsibilities:
Seeing through complex solution-engagement to prospects by supporting internal and external teams.
Delivering tailored technical and functional presentations and demonstrations to customer groups, technical, business up to and including C-Level executives
Owning functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs, being able to respond quickly and gather feedback from product and engineering teams when necessary
Conveying customer requirements and solutions to internal Client Services and Product Management teams
Identifies technical hurdles early in the deal cycle and works to overcome any hurdles using available resources
Works with internal groups (marketing, client services, engineering) updating product presentation content, vetting customer requests
Willingness and able to travel up to 40% and work remotely


Qualifications:
5+ years relevant experience in SaaS software presales or consultancy
Solution-selling and platform sales experience
JavaScript / HTML / CSS web development experience
Conversant in artificial intelligence / machine learning technologies
Knowledge of backend web and system architectures
Retail (B2C and B2B), CPG and/or grocery experience preferred
B.S. in Computer Science or Business & Technology or related field, or the equivalent in education and/or experience

EnsoData, a fast growing, venture-backed startup based in Madison, WI, is seeking an experienced candidate for the position of Senior Frontend Engineer. Reporting to the CTO, this role is a fundamental part of the EnsoData technology team that will take leadership of critical customer-facing application interfaces.
Our goal at EnsoData is to provide artificial intelligence powered software services that create massive cost and time savings for frontline clinicians, allowing them to spend more time with patients and less time with data; improving both patient and provider satisfaction, and patient outcomes. Our first product, EnsoSleep, uses our machine learning engine with big data to save clinicians hundreds of hours per month by automating one of the most arduous and repetitive data annotation tasks in all of healthcare; sleep study scoring.
Requirements
The mission for the Senior Frontend Engineer is to deliver outstanding user experiences and interfaces that delight end-users. This is accomplished by designing and building modern web applications that allow users to intuitively visualize and interact with the wealth of data generated within core EnsoData products.

Outcomes
Build out and maintain EnsoSleep Customer Dashboard
Develop HIPAA-compliant support ticket interface
Design and build customizable report generation templates
Include support for a variety of major browsers
Incorporate a user-friendly mobile viewing experience
Implement a system for gathering and analyzing user interaction data
Build out and maintain internal system monitoring dashboards
Interface for managing customer client application configuration
Dashboard for monitoring services vital to the customer
Competencies
Job
5+ years experience as a frontend or full-stack engineer
Expert in Python, Flask, React, Redux
Experience with designing, building and testing high-quality web applications
Experience with implementing user analytics measures
Bonus: experience working within a HIPAA complaint environment
Culture
Gets things done
Goes above and beyond
Doesn’t cut corners
Shares knowledge
Spreads good vibes
Delights customers
Benefits
In addition to a competitive salary, significant equity in a high-growth startup, and other benefits as added, the Senior Frontend Engineer will have a transformative impact on company culture and success. In this position, you will have the opportunity to grow personally and professionally to help build a world-class engineering team, own critical EnsoData product initiatives, and serve as a key member of the EnsoData technical leadership team.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Fabric Networking - GPU
job_description:
NVIDIA is leading the way in groundbreaking developments in Artificial Intelligence, High-Performance Computing and Visualization. The GPU, our invention, serves as the visual cortex of modern computers and is at the heart of our products and services. Our work opens up new universes to explore, enables amazing creativity and discovery, and powers what were once science fiction inventions from artificial intelligence to autonomous cars.
We are looking for highly motivated Senior Software Engineers to work on our GPU Fabric Networking team. Our team develops and maintains software that enables communication between GPUs, that power disruptive products in High Performance Computing and Deep Learning.
What you will be doing:
Design, implement and maintain system software that enables communication between GPUs.
Participate in the architectural definition and design of next-generation communication hardware and software to support large scale computing platforms.
Work with cross-disciplinary teams to understand business requirements and align software direction to meet those needs.
What we need to see:
B.S/M. S/ Ph.D. in computer science or a related field with 5+ years of relevant experience.
Excellent C/C++ programming and debugging skills.
Shell scripting experience. Python and Perl experience is a plus.
Experience writing software applications that interface with device drivers and expose associated hardware functionality.
Strong understanding of computer system architecture, operating system and kernel internals.
Strong experience with Linux and comfortable working in a cross-platform environment (Linux and Windows).
Experience with multi-core / multi-process / multi-threaded programming environment.
Strong understanding of networking fundamentals and high-performance networks like Ethernet/IB.
Experience with OS virtualization technologies like KVM/QEMU/Hyper-V etc.
Ability and flexibility to work and communicate effectively in a multi-national, multi-time-zone corporate environment.
NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern Artificial Intelligence — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company”. We are looking to grow our teams with the smartest people in the world. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and talented individuals in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
We are now looking for Software Engineers who see the big picture of Cloud Computing and AI. This essential role will give you a rare opportunity to craft and deliver a new class of GPU services for Cloud Computing in the fields of Deep Learning and AI. Your work will create tools to drive Deep Learning, AI and Visual Computing.
What you'll be doing:
Design, build and implement Python SDKs and CLIs to interact with Cloud GPU Services.
Help drive the underlying technology stack and the implementation methodology.
Work closely with other teams on new products or features/improvements of existing products.
Drive performance tuning and automation.
Support, maintain and document software functionality.

BA in CS or equivalent practical experience.
5-8 years of hands-on experience in Python.
Experience writing Integration and Unit tests in Python.
Experience developing Python client code that works across Windows, Linux, and Mac
Experience with RESTful web services.
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills required.

Show previous experience with developing Python CLI and SDKs.

UST Global is a private high growth organization headquartered in Orange County California and is a leading provider of Advanced Computing and Digital Services for Global 1000 companies worldwide. Sr QA Automation Engineer

UST Global is a leading provider of platforms, digital innovation, artificial Intelligence and end to end IT Business services and solutions for Global 1000 companies. We are transforming corporations through deep domain expertise, knowledge based ML platforms, as well as profound anthropological efforts to understand the end customer and design products and interactions that create delight. We are deeply committed to developing a comprehensive understanding of our clients problems and to develop platforms to address them.

The primary objective of the QA Lead is to lead the QA efforts of one or more products as well as manage technical risks throughout the project. The QA Lead is responsible to establish the QA processes within the team, also to set up automation suite. Senior QA should mentor and supervise the QA analysts in the team. BS BA degree in computer science, engineering or related discipline.3 5 or more years of direct experience in software quality assurance software testing,

Prefer Agile Scrum XPExcellent problem solving interpersonal communication skills a must.Thorough knowledge of software testing practices, including test planning, test automation API and UI, and defect managementStrong SQL Scripting skillsWorking knowledge of CI to create builds using Jenkins

Must have proficiency in at least one tool from each category

Java Scripts, GroovyAutomated Testing Junit, Cucumber, Selenium, Mercury QTP 8.2, TestNG, FlexUnit, LoadRunner, SoapUIBrowsers Chrome, Firefox, IEDatabase Tools Oracle, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, SQL Developer or other query toolsOther Tools Jenkins, GIT, Putty, WinScp

The Raytheon Intelligence & Space (RIS) Integrated Digital Intelligence & Automation Systems Engineering team is seeking an enthusiastic, highly motivated and innovative team member to take on the role of Automation Systems Engineer in the McKinney, TX consolidated manufacturing center (CMC). This position will be responsible for executing automation projects within the McKinney factory. The Automation Systems Engineer will work for the McKinney Automation Systems Engineering Manager, and will collaborate with local factory leadership, manufacturing engineering, industrial engineering, operations, supply chain, and front end of the business Automation System Engineers to execute automation development, deployment, and factory sustainment of automation systems. The Automation Systems Engineer incorporates advanced Smart Factory/Industry 4.0 technologies as well as identify opportunities for process improvements via lean techniques. The candidate will also be responsible for maintaining up to date knowledge on automation technologies and Industry 4/Smart Factory concepts as they relate to current/future project execution.

The position will be networked across RIS factories, which includes locations in McKinney (TX), Forest (MS), Santa Barbara County (CA), and Largo (FL), in addition to operations and automation engineers from other Raytheon Technologies business units. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of automation deployment and/or sustainment in a factory setting, including high mix, low volume production.



Required Skills:

Experience in automation design, development, deployment, validation and/or sustainment in a factory setting.
4+ years professional engineering experience in a manufacturing environment, with at least 2 years being directly related to automation and/or controls.
Experience with automation systems (robots, vision systems, PLCs, etc.)
Experience with process integration and electromechanical / mechatronic systems
Understanding of automation programming environments
Experience in mechanical and/or electrical design, computer vision, artificial intelligence, or other related field.
Experience with CAD (Solidworks, Pro E, AutoCAD electrical, etc.)
Ability to demonstrate strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
Time & task management skills
Ability to obtain a DoD Secret clearance
Desired Skills:

Exposure to a wide variety of production machinery, industrial sensors, and equipment (LVDT and pressure transducers, dispense systems, temperature controllers, DC torque controllers, current and power meters, etc.)
Knowledge of Electrical Standards (NFPA79, National Electric code, UL508A).
Knowledge of Safety standards (ANSI/RIA15.06, OSHA).
Experience programming Cartesian, SCARA and Articulated robots is highly desired (Fanuc, UR or others)
Experience with Vision systems (Cognex, Keyence, Fanuc)
Experience creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment is highly desired
Experience transitioning products and processes from prototype to production desired
Debug and optimize automated processes to maximize cycle time, improve availability and yield
Enforce application of Raytheon standards, manage external integrators during specification generation, design review, design approval
Participate in initial equipment conceptual development and carefully balance product specifications, process requirements, layout complexity, cost, and lead-time limits.
Understanding of Lean principles and terminology and/or six sigma black belt or equivalent
Familiarity with Industry 4.0 / Smart Factory concepts, Digital Manufacturing Simulation
Understanding of SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems, MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems), ISA (International Society of Automation) 95 architectures.
Experience with cyber and/or cyber-physical systems security protocols
Experience with PLCs, MTConnect, and/or Transactional Automation (use of API, XML)
Proactively identifies and manages changes in project scope, identifies potential problems, and devises contingency plans
Strong project management and project planning experience/knowledge with demonstrated ability to drive projects to successful completion
Strong interpersonal communication (verbal, written and presentation) skills with the ability to interact positively and collaboratively with others at all levels of the organization
Experience in project management, preferably, as it relates to automation development and deployment, including MS Project schedule development, and financial measures/metrics
Demonstrated ability to develop business cases and Return on Investment analyses

job_title: Sr. Software Engineer, Full Stack Developer
job_description:
Introduction
iRobot Corporation, with a mission of “empowering people to do more” is at the forefront of the development of robotics and artificial intelligence technologies. iRobot has become one of the world’s preeminent specialist designers and builders of consumer robots. iRobot invests in the development and growth of its people, in a culture of empowerment, innovation and fun. Come work with some of the most talented and influential people in the robotics field utilizing cutting edge technologies, in an exciting, fast-growing industry!


Our team's mission is to lead the intelligence revolution for robots, leveraging the power of Machine Learning. Join our Machine Learning team to help us build tooling that will help make our robots smarter!

Work collaboratively within our machine learning team to build AWS-based solutions for exciting new projects and use-cases.
Refactor an existing web application into testable components
Add new features to / Rest Framework–based backend / API and to existing React/Angular-based web frontends.
Work on exciting new frontend capabilities such as visualization/editing of 2D and 3D data.
Write tests to ensure proper functionality of the system.
Write example Python client code / client library that can interact with the system from the command line.
Must have a strong understanding of:
Python
Django
Django Rest Framework (DRF)
Modern JavaScript front-end frameworks, such as React (preferred) and/or Angular
Relational database concepts (SQL) / Django ORM concepts.

Infrastructure as code (IaC) with a preference for CloudFormation
Experience of deploying Django application in the field (WSGI, load balancing, …)
AWS services (S3, ECS, ...) and how to interact with them via python (boto3).
JavaScript 2D drawing libraries (e.g. Fabric.js)
JavaScript 3D drawing libraries (e.g. babylon.js, WebGL, …)
AngularJS
Python packaging concepts

Orchestration of Django background tasks (e.g. RabbitMQ/Celery)
Writing Unit Tests / Continuous Integration

Roku is working on improving the reporting and monitoring of our user experience. The OS department is looking for an engineer to develop data analytics pipeline and visualizations on top of Roku's data platform. You will help product, engineering, and machine learning teams improve the product with data. Examples include monitoring the performance of new features, a/b testing ML models, and compiling reports for executive review.


We expect you to:


Define and develop insights into the accuracy, quality and other metrics for the user's experience while interacting with our artificial intelligence capabilities
Support data aggregation pipelines to maintain reliability and scalability
Help and discuss with the engineering teams' ways of improving the user experience
Write complex queries on Roku's distributed big data servers to gain insights from user behavior
Write code to analyze data to report on outcomes machine learning systems
Create presentations to highlight problems areas uncovered by log analysis
Work with the development team to improve the logging and instrumentation


What we need from you for this role:


B.S. Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field
At least 10 years experience working in a data-related engineering position
Solid programming skills in python and/or scripting languages in a Unix environment
Experience with querying large databases with Hive
Experience with visualizing data with Looker
Practical experience with cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets
Strong oral and written skills
Ability to thrive as a self-driven employee who can follow tasks from conception to production

Company Description

Atollogy's mission is to make operational excellence easy and accessible for companies of all shapes and sizes. Atollogy’s proprietary algorithms and capabilities are revolutionizing how companies manage operations by integrating the physical world with artificial intelligence. Our team of Atollogists has more than 100 years of combined manufacturing industry experience with diverse and unique backgrounds.
If you are passionate about building IoT-based big data solutions for enterprises and are looking to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing startup, then look no further than Atollogy!

Job Description

We’re looking for a Senior Engineer "Full Stack" engineer who will primarily be responsible for developing features and services that put the power of Atollogy's end-to-end integrated machine-vision platform into the hands of our customers. Not only are you excited about developing new features, maintaining existing code, and fixing bugs, you are driven to use all of your experience and more to create real, useful technology solutions and customer value.
Key responsibilities:
Build useful stuff people want.
Develop data intensive customer facing web applications, report interfaces and data feeds.
Design clean end-to-end user experiences by implementing web and/or mobile interfaces using XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Work closely with our product & CSM teams to define feature specifications, core functionality, and help build the next generation of products leveraging frameworks such as Angular, React, D3, or other applicable components.
Apply your knowledge of software architecture, backend app-servers, databases, front-end frameworks, and API design expertise to create coherent, flexible application infrastructure.
Optimize and troubleshoot your applications end-to-end to ensure responsiveness and correctness of the user-experience.
Work closely with devops to build and scale back-end services.
Take operational responsibility for the components that you write.
Have an opinion and an open mind.

Qualifications

5+ years of programming experience using Javascript and Python-3.x
5+ years of experience with a mix of relational, document, and NoSQL databases.
5+ years of experience with foundation level web technologies: JavaScript, XHTML, CSS
3+ years using recent Javascript UI & backend frameworks, like react.js, AngularJS, Node.JS, etc.
Have proficiency and comfort wielding a variety of new technologies along with existing assets to deliver high-value solutions addressing immediate customer needs.
Excellent verbal and written skills.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Purpose: To Unite the world through health and happiness.

Organifi is a fun, fast paced environment of like minded professionals looking to make a difference in the world. We collaborate. We laugh. We’re obsessed with superfoods and we aligned to make BIG positive impact in the world.

Organifi, an industry leader in high quality nutrition products and superfoods is looking for an immediate hire to join our powerhouse team.

Are YOU The Right Fit?

You need to be a top performer. Is that you? If you think so, then you’re probably not. Now if you KNOW so, then ask yourself if this sounds familiar: Are you tired of glass ceilings in your current job? Do you feel held back? Are you curious about what you're REALLY capable of?

Job Summary:

We currently have part of our site on Shopify and part on Unbounce/Clickbank. We are looking for someone to be a leader in our front end development efforts who can not only maintain and add to those pages but also build out a completely new custom site of landing pages complete with checkout (via Stripe, Braintree or the like), upsell flows, (custom and tool based A/B testing), abandon cart features and more. We are looking to take our company to the next level of scale which means clean code, fast webpages, and fast results. We want webpages that load in 400ms to 1,000ms. If you are a high performing developer who loves writing clean code, fast webpages, bringing fast results, working with a collaborative team, being an autonomous player, establishing best practices and wants to have fun at the same time then we want to talk to you ASAP!

Our Director of Technology has done work for the Super Bowl, State Farm, Arizona Lottery, Tilted Kilt, Financial Executives International, hospitals and colleges across the United States and much more. He has also coded Artificial Intelligence and built multiple award winning websites. He loves to share his experience where it can be helpful but also wants to learn from everyone on the team including you. We are a team of learning, leading and striving to be the best at what we do. We all learn from each other and we all have a lot of fun. If you want to grow your career, make an impact on the world and have fun...join us!

Roles and Responsibilities


Build new full new custom website from the ground up with new payment processor like Stripe, Braintree, etc (payment processor TBD)
Maintain Shopify webpages
Maintain Unbounce/Clickbank webages
Love architecting big projects and also love building lots of landing pages for products with multiple upsell flows
Maintain and troubleshoot pixels
Work with backend developers
Work in GA/GTM
Manage HTML/CSS/Javascript cleanliness
Add new pages every time we add new products
Run/maintain A/B tests using tools and ultimately custom
Always think with scalability in mind
Be comfortable building an entire site top to bottom by yourself (even though you will have others to work with you)
Train others, learn from others, set and maintain best practices
Focus on teamwork
Work with various API’s from Google, Organifi, Facebook, Promotor io, Kount, Stripe, etc
Build cross-browser compatible webpages for desktop and mobile with a mobile first mindset
Be able to drive business results fast and not spend forever on code...there is a balance to the art of coding and driving results...we value clean code and we value fast business results
Communicate with project managers and other team members across the company
Write unit/integration/E2E tests
Domain management


Perks:


Unlimited PTO
Ability to work from home
You determine your own work schedule hours
No micro-management...full trust
On-site gym
DDR and ping pong tables
Free products monthly of your choice
Great salary, Bonus and Stock
A company not dependant on funding rounds...fully self sufficient with revenue
A company past all the early experiment phases and now in the fun growth/scale phase


Position Requirements


Shopify and Shopify Plus Experience
4-10 years in Javascript
4-8 years in HTML
4-8 years in CSS
2-4 years working with RESTful APIs
Experience with a payment processor like Stripe, Braintree or other
Ecommerce experience


Strongly Preferred


Knowledge of code design patterns: Facade, Factory, etc
Shopify experience
GA/GTM experience
Google Ads
SEO
PCI, ADA, GDPR, CCPA
AWS Route 53, GoDaddy
XSS Attacks
